attributes.action: Start up a night bus to areas such as East Croydon for women
attributes.additional_details: The government has the resources to put more buses on the roads for women to use to ensure they can safely travel in the evening and at night
attributes.background: Provide buses and accessible public transport for women only at night

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local public transport are a matter for transport operators and the relevant local authority, not the Government or Parliament.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
